channel.title: [VB '08] OpenURL getting a 403 Forbidden!
channel.description:
I have a problem. I am trying to make an auto login for a section on RuneScape ;) I have this code: [code=vb] HTML = Inet1.OpenURL("https://poll.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/login.ws?username=" & txtUsername.Text & "&password=" & strPass, icString)[/code] It connects and stores as HTML, but I was debugging my code and checked the HTML variable. My message box with the string HTML says: [code=html4strict] 405 Method Not Allowed

The requested method CONNECT is not allowed for the URL/.

Apache/2.2.3(CentOS) Server at poll.runescape.com Port 443
[/code] What do I do? Am I connecting through the wrong port?

item.title: [VB '08] OpenURL getting a 403 Forbidden!
item.dc:creator: @Flaming_Idiot Flaming Idiot
item.description:
@Flaming_Idiot wrote:

Use the web client component instead of the INet control. The INet control is outdated.

Dim X As New Net.WebClient Dim HTML = X.DownloadString(String.Format("https://poll.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/login.ws?username={0}&password={1}", _ User, Password))

Read full topic

item.title: [VB '08] OpenURL getting a 403 Forbidden!
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

What the hell is a DOCTYOE, why the hell is in it HTML 2.0, and what the fuck? Jagex’s web servers never spit out shit like this ;\

Read full topic

item.title: [VB '08] OpenURL getting a 403 Forbidden!
item.dc:creator: @Agent766 Agent766
item.description:
@Agent766 wrote:

I have a problem. I am trying to make an auto login for a section on RuneScape

I have this code:

 HTML = Inet1.OpenURL("https://poll.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/login.ws?username=" & txtUsername.Text & "&password=" & strPass, icString)

It connects and stores as HTML, but I was debugging my code and checked the HTML variable. My message box with the string HTML says:

[code=html4strict]<DOCTYOE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN

405 Method Not Allowed

The requested method CONNECT is not allowed for the URL/.

Apache/2.2.3(CentOS) Server at poll.runescape.com Port 443 [/code]

What do I do? Am I connecting through the wrong port?

Read full topic
